did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Malcolm Whyte papers and Troubador Press publications, 1963-1995
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Children's books by various authors, published by Troubador Press, Troubador Press catalogs and other documents including book files, history of Troubador Press and job cards.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE and ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Troubador Press is owned and operated in San Francisco, California by Malcolm Whyte. Whyte graduated from Cornell University in 1955.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Children's books including coloring, cut-out, game, and puzzle books by various authors including Malcolm Whyte and Larry Evans, published by Troubador Press. Also, an Edward Gorey book designed by Whyte, a Great Plains Indians cut-out book, a guidebook for Cornellians in San Francisco, and Troubador Press catalogs and documents demonstrating the step-by-step production of one of the books.
Toss Your Own Ticker Tape Parade and Super Hero Kit by Malcolm Whyte, published by Andrews McMeel Publishing.
Also, additional book files and history of Troubador Press.

"Job cards" documenting the cost of producing various Troubador books and other printing jobs; also, cards regarding the printing of City Lights Publication's books, including 9 printings of Allen Ginsberg's HOWL in which Troubador replaced, at the publisher Lawrence Ferlinghetti's request, the "dirty words" represented only with ellipses with the words as written in Ginsberg's original manuscript.
"Toot-Your-Own-Horn" art, original roughs, manuscripts, correspondence, and kit content examples (1964-1966).

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p:
Books are listed alphabetically by author with the following notations:
c - calligraphy by
cr - created by
d - designed by
e - edited by
i - illustrated by
w - written by

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Malcolm Whyte Papers and Troubador Press Publications, #4411. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Books, publications and kits
Box 1-5

Series II. Files and documents
Box 4, 6-9
